isis.stitle: CAM AIR FOUNDATION BRAKES - REASSEMBLY - BRAKE GROUPS WITH BACKING PLATES

figure.caption: Figure 19. Rockwell "T" Series Brake with Backing Plate

step1.para: Install camshaft assembly. Make sure the spacer washers are reassembled in the same relative position from which they were removed.
Assemble the brake shoe rollers to the shoes if equipped with retainers.
Assemble guide pin washers and position shoes over anchor pins and guide pins.
Install guide pin washer/spring, "C" washer, anchor pin washer, and retainer assemblies.
Install brake shoe return spring.

Pull each shoe back and insert rollers. Installing rollers after shoe return springs are installed requires less effort than installing brake shoe return springs after the rollers are in place. However, if the rollers have retainers they must be assembled to the shoes as stated in step 2.
Reassemble slack adjuster on camshaft, aligning scribe marks and positioning spacer washers in reverse sequence from when adjuster was removed.

step2.para: Use spacer washers to provide a maximum end play of .062 inch (1.59 mm) with adjuster ring installed.

step1.para: Install slack adjuster retaining ring.
Install wheel and drum assembly and adjust wheel bearings. Refer to GROUP 17 - WHEELS, RIMS AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Adjust brakes as outlined in BRAKE ADJUSTMENT.

figure.caption: Figure 20. Eaton Brake With Backing Plate

step1.para: Carefully slip camshaft into bracket. To ensure that the camshaft is properly installed, rotate cam in the direction of the air chamber push rod and check that the rollers would ride up on the convex side of the cam head.
Install inner slack adjuster washer on cam.

note.para: The inner washer is the thick washer which measures .060 inch (1.52 mm) and the outer washer is the thin one that measures .030 inch (.76mm).

step1.para: Install slack adjuster on camshaft so adjuster nut faces away from the air chamber.
Install outer washer and snap ring.
While depressing locking sleeve, rotate adjusting nut counterclockwise until the slack adjuster and push rod clevis holes are aligned (manual slack adjuster).
Install clevis pin and cotter pin.
Place upper shoe on anchor pin and rotate down, fitting shoe into retainer clamp.
Place lower shoe on anchor pin and lift upwards, fitting shoe into retainer clamp.
Attach return spring and anchor pin retaining spring. Use brake pliers.
Using a large screwdriver, lift the brake shoes and install the brake cam rollers.
Install wheel and drum assembly and adjust wheel bearings. Refer to GROUP 17 - WHEELS, RIMS AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Adjust brakes as outlined in BRAKE ADJUSTMENT.
